item.title: We must tackle digital violence to fight gender inequality
We must tackle digital violence to fight gender inequality
item.description: Every year, the global community observes countless designated days, organises events, undertakes projects, and spends millions with the aim of eradicating gender-based violence against women and girls. Yet, despite decades of effort, the needle has barely moved.

item.title: Global South to write 21st century's growth story
Winter nights of inhuman living
Global South to write 21st century's growth story
item.description: As the impacts of climate change become more severe with deadly heatwaves, eroding coastlines, rising food prices, and increasing social and economic instability, affected countries, particularly poor ones, are getting concerned about having to slow their development while addressing climate change.

item.title: At last IMED diagnoses leather park's malaise!
item.description: The imbroglio that the Savar Leather Industrial Park finds itself in is the result of ineptitude and concerns other than the overriding one to turn this facility into a world class leather hub. Begun as early as 2003, the relocation of many tanneries from Dhaka's Hazaribagh took place in 2017

item.description: The verdict against Sheikh Hasina does not just condemn a former prime minister. It sentences an entire model of politics. The deeper question now is whether Awami League survives as a party, or only as a memory of fear and loyalty.

Why Bangladesh can no longer ignore its earthquake risk
item.description: Dhaka and Bangladesh's other densely populated cities stand exposed to alarming seismic hazards—an uncomfortable truth underscored by the magnitude 5.7 earthquake that rattled the nation on November 21, 2025.

item.title: Matiul Islam: A legacy of service, integrity, and love
item.description: It is with profound sorrow that we remember M Matiul Islam, the first finance secretary of Bangladesh, who passed away on Thursday, November 20, at the age of 95.
